data.title: So yummy
data.text: really great shaved dessert.  It's not shaved ice it's more like shaved ice milk.  It is soooo good.  If you haven't tried it's a must.

data.title: Flavored Ice
data.text:
This was the perfect way to escape the recent heatwave that hit LA. It was so good that we ended up coming back here on consecutive weeks. I love that the shaved ice doesn't weight you do or make you feel bloated the way ice cream does.

Checking in with the Yelp app will net you an extra topping if you order the large. Which can easily be shared between two people.

As for my favorite, you can't go wrong with Cantaloupe Ice, Lychee and Grass Jelly Toppings and Chocolate swirls.

data.title: Just like shaved ice, but different.
data.text:
This is shaved ice, but different. They use snow cream from flavored ice blocks (currently offering original, strawberry, green tea and black sesame), and you can add syrups or fruit/toppings. If it's your first time, stick with one of their suggested combos; you can't go wrong that way. Then, after you've got a better sense of what this crazy stuff is, you can be more adventurous.

The portions are generous IMO, and you could easily share one with a friend...unless you don't want to share. :)They also sell Blockhead popscicles, but I have yet to try those.

And lastly, can someone explain to me why this stuff doesn't seem to melt? Get some. You'll see them (noisily) shave the ice block and the cup you get is cold - frozen even. All that is like regular shaved ice. Look closely and you'll see the "snow" is more like super thin soap shavings. And they don't melt! It's really weird. I want to get a bowl and just leave it out for an hour to see if it would puddle or something, but that would be such a waste, no? It's probably a question best left unanswered. Just eat it!

data.title: Not your typical shaved iced
data.text:
For all those desserts/shaved ice/ice cream lovers out there, you have to try this.
Its more like shaved ice cream, since its not really shaved iced and taste more creamy like ice cream.  There are various flavors to choose from and they have combos as well.
Green tea was very good and smooth.
